main event: An unidentified object was tracked on radar near Yuma, Arizona, for 2 hours and 48 minutes on February 27, 1961.
interesting points: The object gradually lost altitude at a rate of approximately 300 feet per minute., The object became diffused and lost contact while descending., Observers considered the object could have been a ballistic missile, satellite, or aircraft., The weather conditions were reported as good visibility and clear skies., Two witnesses, Paul E. Reuter and Morris Royster, were identified as very reliable.
witness description: Paul E. Reuter, A2C, and Morris Royster, Capt., both from the 664th ACWG and deemed very reliable
